question.title: How to use regex in cucumber options for java or how to grep scenario tags with regex for execution
question.body:
I have the following issue in my cucumber java project although I can find all scenarios with a fixed tag name via tags parameter, see below:

@CucumberOptions(plugin = {"json:target/cucumberParallel.json", "rerun:target/failed_scenarios/failed_once_part1.txt"},
        features = {"src/test/resources/part1"},
        tags = "@MY and @NOTMY",
        glue = {"com.stepdefs"},
        monochrome = true)

So, the above would execute all scenarios that have the tags "@MY" and "@NOTMY". Example of gherkin scenario:

  @TESTID-001 @MY @BUG-002
  Scenario: Just a fake case
  ...

So, the above would execute this scenario because of the tag @MY. How can I find all scenarios that have tags starting with @BUG.* like a regex?

I know that cucumber it shelf doen't except regex expressions in the tags parameter.

How can I do this?

Is there a way to add a tag like "@BUG-FINDALL" that will be converted in the cucumber code to a regex expression during the gathering of the scenarios?

question_comments.body: That's not possible. You'd have to tag each scenario with both @bug and @bug-1234.
